metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4515 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The bcm_char_ioctl function in drivers/staging/bcm/Bcmchar.c in the Linuxkernel before 3.12 does not initialize a certain data structure, whichallows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory viaan IOCTL_BCM_GET_DEVICE_DRIVER_INFO ioctl call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4515` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required
